docs.text: Configuration Reference Configurations are stored inside aurora.config.json . Example Configuration { "workerCount": 4, "retryPolicy": "aggressive", "logging": "verbose" } Available Options workerCount : number of active workers retryPolicy : defines retry behavior logging : verbosity level
docs.title: Configuration Reference

docs.text: Configurations are stored inside aurora.config.json .

docs.text: Installation Guide Requirements Node.js 18+ Git 2GB RAM Steps Clone the repository Install dependencies Initialize the engine Commands git clone https://example.com/aurora.git cd aurora npm install

docs.text: Module Development Guide Modules are loaded dynamically at runtime. Module Structure /module-name index.js manifest.json handlers/ Manifest Example { "name": "sample-module", "version": "1.0.0" }
docs.title: Module Development Guide

docs.text: Aurora Engine Overview Aurora Engine is a modular runtime designed for high-performance task orchestration. Features Plugin-ready architecture Automatic scaling Event-driven workflows Basic Example aurora.run({ task: "compile", optimize: true })
docs.title: Aurora Engine Overview

docs.text: Aurora Engine is a modular runtime designed for high-performance task orchestration.
docs.title: Aurora Engine Overview

docs.text: Plugin-ready architecture Automatic scaling Event-driven workflows
docs.title: Features

docs.text: aurora.run({ task: "compile", optimize: true })
docs.title: Basic Example

docs.text: API Reference runTask(name, options) Executes a task with optional runtime parameters. Signature runTask(taskName: string, options?: TaskOptions): Promise<Result> Parameters taskName : task identifier options : optional overrides
docs.title: API Reference

docs.text: Executes a task with optional runtime parameters.
docs.title: runTask(name, options)

docs.text: runTask(taskName: string, options?: TaskOptions): Promise<Result>
docs.title: Signature

docs.text: taskName : task identifier options : optional overrides
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: Troubleshooting Engine fails to start Check your configuration file for missing or invalid fields. Logs show invalid plugin Ensure the plugin folder contains a valid manifest. Debug Command aurora diagnose --full
docs.title: Troubleshooting

docs.text: Check your configuration file for missing or invalid fields.
docs.title: Engine fails to start

docs.text: Ensure the plugin folder contains a valid manifest.
docs.title: Logs show invalid plugin

docs.text: aurora diagnose --full
docs.title: Debug Command

docs.text: Using Aurora Engine To start the engine, use the CLI. Start Command aurora start --env=production Workflow Execution Create a workflow file Define tasks Register handlers Example Workflow task("clean", () => { console.log("Cleaning workspace..."); });
docs.title: Using Aurora Engine

docs.text: To start the engine, use the CLI.
docs.title: Using Aurora Engine

docs.text: aurora start --env=production
docs.title: Start Command

docs.text: Create a workflow file Define tasks Register handlers
docs.title: Workflow Execution
